phases.name: Definition & Scoping
phases.objective: Establish the foundational elements of the Provision 29 framework by defining materiality criteria, identifying material controls through a top-down, risk-based approach, and securing board approval for the scope and governance structure.

keyActivities.name: Establish Steering Committee
keyActivities.description: Secure executive sponsorship and assemble cross-functional team
subTasks: Secure executive sponsorship (CEO/CFO)
Appoint project lead (typically CRO or Head of Risk)
Assemble cross-functional team (Finance, Risk, Compliance, Internal Audit, IT, Operations, Legal, ESG)
Define governance structure, meeting cadence, and escalation protocols

keyActivities.name: Define Materiality Criteria
keyActivities.description: Develop quantitative and qualitative thresholds for material controls
subTasks: Develop quantitative thresholds (financial impact, revenue impact, regulatory penalty exposure)
Establish qualitative criteria (strategic importance, reputational risk, stakeholder significance)
Create materiality decision tree for consistent application
Obtain board approval of criteria

keyActivities.name: Map Principal Risks to Existing Controls
keyActivities.description: Top-down approach starting from board-approved principal risks
subTasks: Review board-approved principal risk register
Identify existing controls that mitigate each principal risk
Assess control coverage and identify gaps
Avoid bottom-up process inventories that lead to control proliferation

keyActivities.name: Create Material Control Inventory (MCI)
keyActivities.description: Apply materiality criteria to create comprehensive control list
subTasks: Apply materiality criteria to identified controls
Document each material control (owner, description, frequency, type)
Target range: 25-100 controls (typical: 40-50)
Categorise by domain (financial, operational, compliance, reporting)

keyActivities.name: Conduct Gap Assessment
keyActivities.description: Identify control coverage gaps and prioritise remediation
subTasks: Identify principal risks with insufficient control coverage
Assess maturity of controls in less-developed areas (operational, ESG)
Prioritise gaps based on risk severity and likelihood
Develop high-level remediation roadmap

keyActivities.name: Develop Resource and Budget Plan
keyActivities.description: Estimate FTE requirements and secure funding
subTasks: Estimate FTE requirements for Phases 2-4
Assess need for external support (consultants, co-sourcing)
Develop business case for GRC technology platform
Secure budget approval

deliverables.name: Material Control Inventory (MCI)
deliverables.description: Comprehensive list of 25-100 material controls with preliminary documentation

deliverables.name: Materiality Definition Document
deliverables.description: Board-approved criteria and decision tree

deliverables.name: Gap Assessment Report
deliverables.description: Identification of control coverage gaps and remediation priorities

deliverables.name: Steering Committee Charter
deliverables.description: Governance structure, roles, and responsibilities

deliverables.name: Resource and Budget Plan
deliverables.description: Approved funding and capacity allocation for Phases 2-4

successMetrics: Board approval of materiality criteria obtained
Material Control Inventory contains 25-100 controls (avoiding over-scoping)
All principal risks mapped to at least one material control
Steering committee established with executive sponsorship
Budget and resources secured for subsequent phases
GRC platform vendor selection process initiated

proceed: The board has formally approved the Material Control Inventory and materiality criteria
Budget and resources for Phase 2 are secured
Executive sponsorship is confirmed and active
doNotProceed: The MCI contains >100 controls (indicates insufficient materiality filtering; risk of unmanageable scope)
The board has not engaged with or approved the framework
Budget or resources are not secured (project will stall in Phase 2)

resourceRequirements.externalSupport: Optional: External consulting for framework design; GRC vendor evaluation support

commonPitfalls.solution: Start top-down from principal risks; apply strict materiality criteria

commonPitfalls.impact: Lack of organisational prioritisation and resource allocation
commonPitfalls.solution: Schedule board workshop in Week 1-2; secure executive sponsor immediately
Combine quantitative thresholds with qualitative factors; document decision tree

phases.name: Design & Documentation
phases.objective: Formalise control definitions, remediate design gaps, define effectiveness criteria, and establish testing protocols for all material controls.

keyActivities.name: Formalise Control Definitions
keyActivities.description: Document who, what, how often for each material control
subTasks: Create standardised control documentation template
Document control objective, design, frequency, and evidence for each control
Assign named control owners (individuals, not departments)
Store definitions in centralised repository

keyActivities.name: Map Controls to Framework
keyActivities.description: Align material controls to COSO 2013 or ISO 31000
subTasks: Map each control to relevant COSO component or ISO 31000 process
Document framework alignment for audit trail
Identify any framework coverage gaps
Create control-to-framework mapping matrix

keyActivities.name: Define Effectiveness Criteria
keyActivities.description: Establish measurable outcomes for each control
subTasks: Define quantified effectiveness criteria (e.g., '100% of reconciliations within 5 days')
Establish pass/fail thresholds
Document KPIs for continuous monitoring
Obtain control owner agreement on criteria

keyActivities.name: Implement Remediation Plans
keyActivities.description: Address gaps identified in Phase 1
subTasks: Execute high-priority remediation actions
Track remediation progress against milestones
Validate remediated controls through design testing
Update MCI with remediated controls

keyActivities.name: Define Testing Protocols
keyActivities.description: Establish testing methodologies by control type
subTasks: Document testing methods (sample-based, continuous monitoring, attestation)
Define sample sizes and statistical approaches
Establish evidence requirements
Create testing calendar and frequency plan

keyActivities.name: Confirm Control Ownership
keyActivities.description: Secure formal acceptance of control ownership
subTasks: Conduct control owner workshops (1st line of defence)
Obtain signed acknowledgement of ownership
Document ownership in control library
Clarify escalation paths and accountabilities

deliverables.name: Updated Risk & Control Framework
deliverables.description: Fully documented material controls with ownership and definitions

deliverables.name: Control Effectiveness Criteria Document
deliverables.description: Measurable outcomes and KPIs for each material control

deliverables.name: Testing Protocol Manual
deliverables.description: Standardised testing methodologies by control type

deliverables.name: Remediation Log
deliverables.description: Tracking of gap closure and action completion

deliverables.name: COSO/ISO Mapping Matrix
deliverables.description: Alignment of controls to framework components

successMetrics: All material controls have documented ownership, frequency, and effectiveness criteria
100% of controls mapped to COSO/ISO 31000 framework
Control design gaps remediated or on remediation track
Testing protocols defined and approved by 2nd line
First-line control owners formally accepted ownership

proceed: Control framework is fully documented with clear ownership and effectiveness criteria
GRC platform implementation is on track (even if not fully complete, must be progressing)
First-line control owners are trained and aware of their responsibilities
doNotProceed: Control definitions are incomplete or unclear (will undermine testing in Phase 3)
Control ownership is not formally accepted (creates accountability gaps)
GRC platform implementation is significantly delayed (risk of manual processes in Phase 4)

resourceRequirements.externalSupport: Optional: Control documentation support; GRC platform implementation partner

commonPitfalls.impact: Subjective testing; inability to declare effectiveness
commonPitfalls.solution: Use quantified, measurable criteria with clear thresholds

commonPitfalls.impact: Accountability gaps; controls fall through cracks
commonPitfalls.solution: Assign named individuals as control owners; document in control library

commonPitfalls.impact: Control owners don't understand their role; poor execution in Phase 4
commonPitfalls.solution: Run interactive workshops; secure written ownership acknowledgement

phases.name: Assurance Preparation
phases.objective: Build assurance infrastructure for FY2026 evidence collection, conduct dry run effectiveness assessment, and prepare board reporting mechanisms.

keyActivities.name: Establish Three Lines of Defence RACI
keyActivities.description: Clarify roles and responsibilities across 3LoD
subTasks: Create RACI matrix for control design, execution, testing, reporting
Define 1st line (control execution), 2nd line (oversight), 3rd line (assurance) boundaries
Obtain steering committee approval of RACI
Communicate roles to all three lines

keyActivities.name: Complete Assurance Mapping
keyActivities.description: Map assurance sources across 1st, 2nd, 3rd lines
subTasks: Identify assurance sources for each material control
Document assurance frequency and methodology
Identify and address assurance gaps
Create comprehensive assurance map

keyActivities.name: Deploy GRC Platform
keyActivities.description: Implement technology platform for control management
subTasks: Complete platform configuration and integration
Migrate control library to GRC platform
Set up workflows, testing schedules, and dashboards
Conduct user acceptance testing

keyActivities.name: Train First-Line Control Owners
keyActivities.description: Build capability in control execution and self-assessment
subTasks: Develop training materials (guides, videos, workshops)
Deliver training sessions to all control owners
Test knowledge through simulations
Track training completion

keyActivities.name: Develop Board Dashboard
keyActivities.description: Create executive reporting mechanism ('Approach on a Page')
subTasks: Design dashboard with Material Risks, Control Effectiveness, Assurance Coverage
Test dashboard with sample data
Obtain Audit Committee feedback
Finalise dashboard format and refresh cadence

keyActivities.name: Conduct Dry Run
keyActivities.description: Execute 6-8 week pilot effectiveness assessment
subTasks: Test full control execution and evidence collection cycle
Conduct sample testing of controls
Generate draft board dashboard
Present dry run results to board
Document lessons learned and implement improvements

deliverables.name: Assurance Coverage Matrix
deliverables.description: Complete mapping of 1st, 2nd, 3rd line assurance by control

deliverables.name: RACI Matrix (Three Lines of Defence)
deliverables.description: Role clarity for control framework governance

deliverables.name: Operational GRC Platform
deliverables.description: Fully configured technology platform with control library

deliverables.name: Board Dashboard
deliverables.description: Real-time executive reporting on control effectiveness

deliverables.name: Dry Run Report
deliverables.description: Pilot test results, lessons learned, and improvement actions

deliverables.name: FY2026 Testing Calendar
deliverables.description: Scheduled testing plan for full-year evidence collection

successMetrics: Dry run successfully completed with board review
GRC platform operational and integrated with business systems
Board dashboard tested and approved
Assurance mapping complete with no gaps
Board expresses confidence in readiness for 2026
Training completion: 100% of control owners

decisionGate.name: Gate 3: Dry Run Success & Board Confidence

proceed: Dry run executed without major failures
GRC platform fully deployed and stable
Lessons learned documented and remediation plan in place
Board expresses confidence in readiness for FY2026
doNotProceed: Dry run revealed fundamental control design flaws
GRC platform not operational (cannot support FY2026 evidence collection)
Board lacks confidence; significant concerns raised

resourceRequirements.externalSupport: GRC platform implementation partner; training delivery support

commonPitfalls.impact: Lessons not learned; issues surface in FY2026
commonPitfalls.solution: Conduct genuine stress-test; treat failures as learning opportunities

commonPitfalls.pitfall: Board dashboard too detailed or too vague
commonPitfalls.impact: Board disengagement or lack of insight
commonPitfalls.solution: Focus on 'Approach on a Page': RAG status, key issues, trends

commonPitfalls.impact: Manual processes in FY2026; scalability issues
commonPitfalls.solution: Start GRC vendor selection in Phase 1; have platform operational by Week 48

phases.name: Effectiveness Testing & Declaration
phases.objective: Collect full-year assurance evidence, conduct structured testing, remediate any ineffective controls, and prepare board declaration for inclusion in 2026 annual report.

keyActivities.name: Execute Continuous Testing Programme
keyActivities.description: Ongoing control execution and evidence collection throughout FY2026
subTasks: 1st line: Execute controls per defined frequency
1st line: Conduct monthly self-assessments
2nd line: Perform quarterly independent testing
3rd line: Conduct annual framework assurance (Internal Audit)

keyActivities.name: Quarterly Board Reporting
keyActivities.description: Regular updates on control effectiveness
subTasks: Generate board dashboard quarterly (Q1, Q2, Q3, Q4 FY2026)
Present dashboard to Audit Committee, then Board
Conduct deep-dive sessions on control domains
Track and report issues and remediations

keyActivities.name: Issue Remediation & Tracking
keyActivities.description: Address any control deficiencies identified during testing
subTasks: Log all control failures with root cause analysis
Develop and implement remediation plans
Track remediation progress
Re-test remediated controls
Escalate persistent issues to Audit Committee

keyActivities.name: Compile Evidence Dossier
keyActivities.description: Assemble comprehensive evidence supporting board declaration
subTasks: Collect testing evidence from 1st, 2nd, 3rd lines
Organise evidence by control and timeframe
Document evidence gaps (if any)
Prepare audit-ready evidence repository

keyActivities.name: Prepare Board Declaration
keyActivities.description: Draft declaration statement for annual report
subTasks: Draft declaration wording (effectiveness or explanation of ineffectiveness)
Obtain CFO, CRO, and Audit Committee review
Present draft to full Board for approval
Finalise declaration for inclusion in annual report

keyActivities.name: Annual Report Disclosure
keyActivities.description: Complete public disclosure in compliance with Provision 29
subTasks: Draft monitoring and review process description
Document any ineffective controls and remediation plans
Prepare comparison to prior year (if applicable)
Obtain Board approval of final annual report content

deliverables.name: Assurance Evidence Dossier
deliverables.description: Complete evidence supporting control effectiveness for FY2026

deliverables.name: Board Declaration Support Pack
deliverables.description: Executive summary, RAG status, evidence summary for Board approval

deliverables.name: Annual Report Disclosure Content
deliverables.description: Final wording for annual report Provision 29 compliance

deliverables.name: Year-End Control Effectiveness Report
deliverables.description: Comprehensive assessment of material controls performance

successMetrics: Board able to declare effectiveness (or explain ineffectiveness with remediation plans)
Full-year evidence collected and organised
Quarterly board reviews completed
Any ineffective controls remediated or on remediation track
Annual report disclosure complies with FRC requirements
Board confidence in declaration

proceed: Evidence dossier is complete and audit-ready
All material controls tested throughout FY2026
Board has reviewed quarterly dashboards and is informed
Any ineffective controls are documented with remediation plans
Board approves declaration for annual report
explanation: Board declares effectiveness if all controls effective
Board explains ineffectiveness with remediation if 1+ controls ineffective
Declaration includes: monitoring process description, explicit effectiveness statement, remediation details (if applicable)

resourceRequirements.externalSupport: Optional: External assurance provider; annual report drafting support

commonPitfalls.solution: Continuous testing throughout FY2026; quarterly evidence reviews

commonPitfalls.impact: Board cannot make informed declaration; FRC scrutiny
commonPitfalls.solution: Transparent escalation of issues; robust remediation tracking
Monthly evidence collection; quarterly completeness checks
